text:
[Click]: Flip this identity.

The Runner pays 1[Credits] more when spending a [Click] to remove a tag (not through a card ability).

Flip side:

[Click]: Flip this identity.

You may pay 2[Credits] fewer when spending a [Click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability).
title: SYNC: Everything, Everywhere

flavor: Nothing but the Truth.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may play 1 current from HQ or Archives (paying its play cost).
title: New Angeles Sol: Your News

flavor: We're ready to start the fire.
text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[Credits].
title: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach

flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.
text:
[Click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: 15 Minutes

flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." -KR Kane, "Our Future"
text: All tracer ice have +1 strength. The base trace strength of each subroutine is increased by 1.
title: Improved Tracers

flavor: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." -Phineas Taylor Barnum
text: All assets gain advertisement.
title: Rebranding Team

flavor: "Yes and No."
text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.
title: Quantum Predictive Model

flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."
text: When you rez Lily Lockwell, draw 3 cards. [Click], remove 1 tag: Search R&D for an operation, reveal it, and shuffle the rest of R&D. Add the operation to the top of R&D.
title: Lily Lockwell

text:
If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth −1 agenda point.
title: News Team

flavor: No one can bury a story better.
text:
[Click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of R&D.
[Trash]: Search R&D or Archives for an agenda and reveal it. Shuffle the rest of R&D if you searched it. Add the agenda to the bottom of R&D.
title: Shannon Claire

text:
The Runner has 1 fewer [Click] to spend during his or her turn.
If Victoria Jenkins is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
title: Victoria Jenkins

flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." -MaxX
text:
When you rez Reality Threedee, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] (or 2[Credits] if the Runner is tagged).
title: Reality Threedee

text: If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. If you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives. [Subroutine] Trace6– If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.
title: Archangel

flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."
text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
title: News Hound

flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory
text: Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, end the run.
title: Resistor

flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori
text: [Subroutine] The Corp gains 5[Credits]. Trash Special Offer.
title: Special Offer

flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice
text: [Subroutine] When the Runner encounters the next piece of ice during this run, that ice gains a second copy of each subroutine on it (after the original subroutine) for the remainder of the encounter.
title: TL;DR

flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru
text: When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
title: Turnpike

flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...
text:
As an additional cost to play 24/7 News Cycle, forfeit an agenda.
Resolve the "when scored" ability on an agenda in your score area.
title: 24/7 News Cycle

text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Install and rez (paying all costs) X advertisements from Archives and/or HQ, if able.
title: Ad Blitz

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Choose an agenda in the Runner's score area. Media Blitz gains the text of that agenda.
title: Media Blitz

flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." -The Playbook
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash all resources. The Runner can remove 1 bad publicity to prevent this.
title: The All-Seeing I

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner must spend credits first for each trace attempt during a run.
title: Surveillance Sweep

flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."
text: [Trash], remove 1 tag: Trash 1 program. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
title: Keegan Lane

flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.
text: The base trace strength of each trace during a run on this server is increased by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Rutherford Grid

flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." -Sunny Lebeau
text: Global Food Initiative is worth 1 fewer agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
title: Global Food Initiative

text:
Place 6[Credits] from the bank on Launch Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Launch Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[Credits] from Launch Campaign.
title: Launch Campaign

flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.
text: [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, do 3 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, trash 1 program.
title: Assassin

text: You cannot install non-virtual resources. When your turn begins, you may install 1 card from your grip facedown.
title: Apex: Invasive Predator

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.
title: Apocalypse

text: Make a run. Once during this run, when you pass a piece of ice, you may trash a number of your installed cards equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, trash that ice.
title: Prey

flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe
text: +1[Memory Unit] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Heartbeat

flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
text: Trash an installed card: Break "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine.
title: Endless Hunger

text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.
title: Harbinger

flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve
text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[Trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.
title: Hunting Grounds

flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.
text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[Credits].
title: Wasteland

text: You start the game with 3 different directive cards installed (these cards are not considered part of your deck).
title: Adam: Compulsive Hacker

flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.
text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).
title: Independent Thinking

text: +X[Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Brain Chip

flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.
text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.
title: Multithreader

flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.
text: Your first [Click] each turn must be spent to make a run or a play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [Click][Click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.
title: Always Be Running

flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."
text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.
title: Dr. Lovegood

flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.
text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, you must trash it by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.
title: Neutralize All Threats

flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.
text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.
title: Safety First

flavor: "Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."
title: Sunny Lebeau: Security Specialist

flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.
text: [Trash]: Choose an icebreaker (or any number of cloud icebreakers). Each chosen icebreaker has +1 strength for each [Link] you have for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
title: Security Chip

text: +1[Memory Unit] +1[Link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace5– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.
title: Security Nexus

flavor: Bigger.
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
title: GS Striker M1

flavor: Badder.
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
title: GS Shrike M2

flavor: Boom.
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
title: GS Sherman M3

flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.
text:
Install only if you have at least 2[Link].
When your turn begins, you may lose [Click]. If you do, look at the top card of R&D.
title: Globalsec Security Clearance

flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."
text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [Link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.
title: Jak Sinclair

flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.
title: Employee Strike

flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.
text: Shuffle your stack. Trash the top card of your stack. Gain X[Credits] where X is equal to the install cost of that card.
title: Windfall

flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.
text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[Credits] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[Click],[Trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.
title: Technical Writer
